keyMoments.description: The Risky Brothers zombie squirrels make their first appearance serving under Perona as part of Thriller Bark's zombie army.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of these minor zombie characters

names.japanese: バーソロミュー・くま

keyMoments.description: Kuma arrives at Thriller Bark to meet with Gecko Moria, bringing news about the Seven Warlords and the World Government's view of the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: First time Kuma appears at Thriller Bark in the arc, delivering crucial world-building information

keyMoments.description: Kuma informs Moria that Marshall D. Teach (Blackbeard) has been appointed as Crocodile's replacement in the Seven Warlords.
keyMoments.significance: Delivers major plot revelation connecting to larger One Piece storyline

keyMoments.description: Kuma reveals that the World Government now considers the Straw Hat Pirates a serious threat after Luffy defeated Rob Lucci.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the escalating stakes for the Straw Hats and foreshadows future danger

keyMoments.description: Moria deceives Luffy by having him chase his shadow clone (Doppelman) instead of his real body.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Moria's tactical cunning and use of his Devil Fruit abilities

keyMoments.description: Moria meets with Bartholomew Kuma to discuss Blackbeard's appointment as a Warlord and the World Government's view of the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Moria's role and connections within the Warlord system

keyMoments.description: Moria enters the cockpit inside Oars' stomach, combining his strategic intelligence with Oars' overwhelming physical power.
keyMoments.significance: Creates the ultimate threat of the arc - the fusion of brains and brawn

abilities.name: Doppelman Control
abilities.description: Moria uses his shadow clone to deceive enemies and escape pursuit

abilities.name: Oars Cockpit Control
abilities.description: Moria controls Oars from within a specially designed cockpit in the giant's stomach

keyMoments.description: Zoro tests his newly acquired sword Shusui against Oars, using an enhanced Hyakuhachi Pound Ho technique.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro adapting to Shusui's power and weight, acknowledging he hasn't fully mastered it yet

abilities.name: Enhanced Hyakuhachi Pound Ho with Shusui
abilities.description: Zoro's signature technique executed with the legendary black blade Shusui, significantly more powerful than with his previous swords

keyMoments.description: Luffy realizes he has been chasing Moria's shadow (Doppelman) the entire time, not the real Warlord.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy can be outmaneuvered tactically despite his combat skills

reveals.description: The World Government now considers Luffy and the Straw Hats a serious threat after defeating Rob Lucci at Enies Lobby

keyMoments.description: Brook arrives with a large bag of salt and saves Usopp from zombie attackers at a critical moment.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Brook's resourcefulness and the crew's use of salt as an anti-zombie weapon

names.japanese: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

keyMoments.description: Blackbeard is revealed to have been appointed as Crocodile's replacement in the Seven Warlords of the Sea.
keyMoments.significance: Major world-building moment showing Blackbeard's rise to power and official recognition by the World Government

keyMoments.description: Flashback shows Blackbeard during his confrontation with Portgas D. Ace, revealing he was formerly part of Whitebeard's crew before betraying them.
keyMoments.significance: Provides crucial backstory about Blackbeard's betrayal and his capture of Ace

reveals.description: Appointed as one of the Seven Warlords of the Sea, replacing Crocodile
Former member of Whitebeard's crew who betrayed them and captured Portgas D. Ace

keyMoments.description: Flashback shows Ace during his confrontation with Blackbeard on Banaro Island.
keyMoments.significance: References the crucial event that led to Ace's capture and Blackbeard's rise to power

reveals.description: Captured by Blackbeard, which led to Blackbeard's appointment as a Warlord
